TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit NavigationTermSetView extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.FreezableObject
Public NotInheritable Class NavigationTermSetView Inherits FreezableObject

Docs.summary: Represents contextual information that affects the calculation of certain properties for the objects in a object.

remarks.para: The object, site map provider, and policy for trimming child nodes are all examples of contextual information that the NavigationTermSetView object can hold.

The class represents contextual information that is used when rendering a navigation term set, but which is not stored in the or cached by the taxonomy navigation cache. Therefore, the NavigationTermSetView class is not considered to be part of the term set. Nonetheless, this contextual information affects the behavior of NavigationTerm object and NavigationTermSet object, similar to how a physical object's appearance may change when viewed from different angles.

The property is a member of both the NavigationTermSet class and NavigationTerm class, and is carried along while traversing the hierarchy. For example, after calling the method, the returned object will have the view, and so will any other objects obtained from members such as the property and property.

The property is read-only and fixed for a specified object instance. Therefore, the view-changing operations always return a new instance of the NavigationTerm object or NavigationTermSet object. Returning the NavigationTerm object or the NavigationTermSet object facilitates internal performance optimizations that require immutable objects.

It is possible for an object to be configured to inherit its navigation term set from the parent SPWeb (specified by using the value). In this situation, the NavigationTermSetView object of the parent SPWeb object is also used for the child SPWeb object. In other words, the property reflects the SPWeb object where the term set was configured, instead of the SPWeb object that is inheriting the navigation.

example.para: The example below constructs a new term set and enables managed navigation for an SPWeb object with /web1 as the URL.

Docs.param: Initializes the property, the property, the property, and the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of a object by using the context of the provided object and the property.

remarks.para: The constructor does not enable trimming. In other words, the property, the property, and the property are initialized to false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ExcludeDeprecatedTerms { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ExcludeDeprecatedTerms : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether objects are trimmed if the underlying term is deprecated..
Docs.value: true if NavigationTerm objects are trimmed if the underlying term is deprecated; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: When traversing the tree of NavigationTerm objects, if this property is true, then terms are excluded from the collectioin whenever the property is true.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ExcludeTermsByPermissions { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ExcludeTermsByPermissions : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether objects are trimmed if the current user does not have permission to view the target page for the friendly URL of the NavigationTerm object.
Docs.value: A Boolean value that indicates whether a view of a term is excluded.

remarks.para: When traversing the tree, if this property is true, then the objects will be excluded if the current user does not have permissions to view them. This security trimming is applied only for NavigationTerm objects that point to pages in the current web.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ExcludeTermsByProvider { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ExcludeTermsByProvider : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether objects are trimmed if the provider indicated by the property is one of the providers in the excluded providers collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTermSetView GetCopy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an editable copy of the current object.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current NavigationTermSetView object.

remarks.para: Thiiis method is used primarily when modifying a view that already belongs to a object, and is therefore frozen.

member this.SiteMapProviderName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The name of a instance that identifies the navigation menu to be used when applying the property.

remarks.para: This property may be initialized to an empty string, in which case the ExcludeTermsByProvider trimming has no effect for this view. This property cannot be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
